rComments: Bruh. This is horrible. If you have a choice to not take HIS class - USE THIS OPPORTUNITY and SAVE YOURSELF. Tests were cursed, lectures were disorganized, practice/homework/tutorial questions did not help to prepare for the exam, material that wasn't covered was tested.

Michael can seem like a bad professor and make you hate economics at first, but he prepares you well for future econ courses. His lecture notes are long but complete, organized, and easy to understand. His lectures can often be boring but you'll always leave the room with a clear understanding of the concept. He also makes jokes sometimes.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Clear grading criteria', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: He is not taking responsibility for students' understanding of concepts.
The lectures were really useless. The level of teaching is unacceptable. I do not recommend this professor, he does not care about his students, so avoid taking any courses with this teacher.

I actually quite like his lectures, as he often makes some nice jokes. I've never went to office hours before but I've heard that he's quite accessible there. However, Michael gives too little helpful practice problems (Sapling is laughably easy) and the final was almost unfair as it tested mathematical content he never covered.

Horrendous prof. Lectures are too fast, unclear. Tests are extremely difficult and go over "lecture discussion" that is not really covered in depth in class. Professor's teaching methodology is tremendously bigoted and one-sided - Ho is a despicable human being. Tests are not curved.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy']

rComments: If you can choose another professor, then decisively choose another professor. If you can only take his class, wait until the next semester to choose another professor.

Pretty terrible prof overall. Teaching has no structure, talks super fast on top of a heavy accent. Does not prepare you for the exams, which were unfairly difficult compared to the lecture notes. Doesn't post notes anywhere. For the majority of the semester it was hard to even figure out a way to study for his exams.
provided no practice questions or anyways to test your knowledge. Did provide his past summer exams but they were extremely easy.
very poor lecturer, and tests do not include the content he teaches,

He is very hard to understand. I took higher-level IB econ in high school and got 97%. I don't want to sound obnoxious at all but I understood this content extremely well and received the IB econ award in my high school. However, Ho teaches this content in such an unorganized, unclear and fast pace way it is impossible for someone to learn.
His lectures are useless and he is very impatient. I find him very rude and he often makes me cry.

His teaching is fine. He is a good professor tho. The exams are just hard. It almost feels like he is intentionally failing our class. There's also rumors saying that when her daughter was in the class last year the exam is super easy. So yeah...
He always comes up with extremely hard tests compare to other professors. fact: the class average of his first term test was 48.3.

Very caring guy who is great at office hours. He makes his lectures as interesting as possible with the joke or two which is appreciated but he writes rather fast. Clearly a smart guy who's dedicated to his field, but his tests are quite hard. Doesn't curve tests like some of the other ECO101 profs which was frustrating.
Professor Ho is really patient every time I go ask him questions after a lecture.

His lectures are simply useless. Provides no useful notes during class except for his unclear repetition of textbook materials. Terrible, terrible teacher that shows absolutely no concern for his students. Please, choose any other ECO101 teacher that is not Michael Ho.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Test heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: He opts to write on a stack of printer paper with an overhead camera instead of using the massive drawing tablet in the lecture hall. He regurgitates information almost directly from the textbook so you're better off just reading a chapter everyweek and going to tutorials. It saves time and provides you with a better understanding of the content.
Show up to class and you will still fail

Prof. Ho is a very good lecture and explains the concepts crystal clear. His accent is not a problem for learning and it is completely understandable. Furthermore, his tests are fair and you should definitely do the tutorial questions because some of them are in the test. He is also very caring about his students and very approachable.

Prof. Ho is a pretty decent lecturer (has an accent but understanding him is not an issue). The exams are fair and straightforward but a lot is taken straight from tutorial and lecture examples so you have to go to class. As long as you go to lectures and take good notes, the course should be fairly easy.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Graded by few things', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: StyleThis professors teaching style is very straightforward and logical, almost black and white. Force yourself to accept this. Materials Lectures are based close to the required reading material. Exams Exams are entirely based on what he covered in class, topics not covered but in the required reading chapters are not tested. Good luck!

Class entirely based on going to class in person and taking notes. Prof does not post any lecture notes or slides at all for students on blackboard. Also exams are closely related to what prof discusses and go over in class. If you are not planning to attend his lectures, this is not the class for you. Course average was C- in last summer session.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy']

rComments: Both midterm and final exam were fair. It is not hard to receive a good grade if you attend every class, which started at 9 am, and pay attention during lecture.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: Not a helpful professor , he is rarely accessible outside of class. He does not post any lecture notes. Midterms and exams are based on class lecture and the textbook, be well prepared to take notes fast. He writes the notes and in a poor manner, not organized or detailed. Go to class or you will fail as he posts almost nothing.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Seriously, I can't believe he is a prof in UofT.

His lectures are fast, gotta take notes very quickly, be aware of this. Midterm and final exam are not too difficult but not easy, very fair. They're all based on weekly readings and lecture notes. If you read and take good notes in class, you should be fine.
